parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Environment

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Returns clouds occlusion between two given points.

</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value> <template><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>edeneditor</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>SimulWeather seems to be disabled in [[Eden Editor]] and scenario preview.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> [[simulCloudOcclusion]] [pos1, pos2]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> pos1: [[Position]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> pos2: [[Position]]

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> 
* [[Number]] - (0 - no clouds, 1 - full clouds)
* [[Nothing]] - If arguments are incorrect
* [[Boolean]] - Returns [[false]] if simulWeather is disabled

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _posPlayer [[a = b|=]] [[getPos]] [[player]];
[[private]] _posAbovePlayer [[a = b|=]] [[+]]_posPlayer; _posAbovePlayer [[set]] [2,200];
[[simulCloudOcclusion]] [_posPlayer, _posAbovePlayer];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setSimulWeatherLayers]], [[simulCloudDensity]], [[simulInClouds]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 8 August, 2014 - 12:17</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Waffle SS.|Waffle SS.]]</dt>
<dd class="note">The '''simulCloudOcclusion''' command is not recognized on dedicated servers, and will produce an error.  If you use this command, it '''cannot''' be anywhere within a script that is run on the dedicated server, or the entire script will halt.  To get around this, you can use: <code>if ![[isDedicated]] then {[] [[execVM]] "simulCloudOcclusionScript.sqf"};</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
